content: Megalithic burial sites and tools discovered in various parts of Andhra, particularly in the Krishna River Valley.
The Satavahana dynasty establishes control over the region, making Dharanikota (near modern Amaravati) their capital.
The Ikshvaku dynasty rules from Vijayapuri (modern-day Nagarjunakonda), promoting Buddhism and Sanskrit literature.
The Vishnukundina dynasty establishes their kingdom with capital at Vengi, contributing to literature and arts.
The Eastern Chalukyas establish their rule from Vengi, beginning a golden age of Telugu literature.
The Chola empire extends influence over coastal Andhra, leading to cultural synthesis.
The Kakatiya dynasty rises to power at Warangal, building grand temples and water management systems.
The Delhi Sultanate defeats the Kakatiyas, bringing Islamic influence to the region.
The Vijayanagara Empire gains control over the region, leading to a renaissance in Telugu literature.
The Qutb Shahi dynasty of Golconda extends control over coastal Andhra, promoting Persian culture.
The Mughal Empire annexes Golconda, bringing the region under their administration.
The British East India Company gains control of the Northern Circars region.
The Nizam of Hyderabad cedes coastal Andhra districts to the British East India Company.
The region participates in the Indian Rebellion, with resistance centered in the Srikakulam area.
The formation of the Andhra Mahasabha marks the beginning of organized Telugu language movement.
India gains independence, with Andhra region split between Madras State and Hyderabad State.
Andhra State is formed as the first linguistic state in India, separated from Madras State.
Andhra Pradesh is formed by merging Andhra State with Telugu-speaking regions of Hyderabad State.
Chandrababu Naidu becomes Chief Minister, initiating IT industry growth and economic reforms.
The Indian Ocean tsunami impacts the coastal regions of Andhra Pradesh.
Andhra Pradesh undergoes bifurcation with the creation of Telangana state, establishing new capital at Amaravati.
Capital city plan changes with the proposal of three capitals system: Amaravati, Visakhapatnam, and Kurnool.
